page.title: 03Shepshed-Growing Population
page.content: A{Charnwood Borough}survey in 1981 showed that{Shepshed}was one of the fastest growing towns in {Leicestershire.}The population in{1951 was just over{6000.}By{1981}this number had grown to{11000,}and the council predicts that by{1991}there will be{13500}people living in Shepshed. We can see evidence of this growth in the large number of new houses being built. Most of the new developments are near the{motorway {junction.}All the houses are built of {brick,}but there is an interesting variety of styles, from four_bedroomed detached houses to two_bedroomed terraced "starter homes",and flats for single people .Alot of bungalows are being built ,which are popular with old people .Modern energy saving features such as insulation, are included in all types of houses.
